verses.text: I love the \sc Lord\sc*, because he hath heard My voice \add and\add* my supplications.
Because he hath inclined his ear unto me, Therefore will I call upon \add him\add* as long as I live.
The sorrows of death compassed me, And the pains of hell gat hold upon me: I found trouble and sorrow.
Then called I upon the name of the \sc Lord\sc*; O \sc Lord\sc*, I beseech thee, deliver my soul.
Gracious \add is\add* the \sc Lord\sc*, and righteous; Yea, our God \add is\add* merciful.
The \sc Lord\sc* preserveth the simple: I was brought low, and he helped me.
Return unto thy rest, O my soul; For the \sc Lord\sc* hath dealt bountifully with thee.
For thou hast delivered my soul from death, Mine eyes from tears, \add And\add* my feet from falling.
I will walk before the \sc Lord\sc* In the land of the living.
I believed, therefore have I spoken: I was greatly afflicted:
I said in my haste, All men \add are\add* liars.
What shall I render unto the \sc Lord\sc* \add For\add* all his benefits towards me?
I will take the cup of salvation, And call upon the name of the \sc Lord\sc*.
I will pay my vows unto the \sc Lord\sc* Now in the presence of all his people.
Precious in the sight of the \sc Lord\sc* \add Is\add* the death of his saints.
Oh \sc Lord\sc*, truly I \add am\add* thy servant; I \add am\add* thy servant, \add and\add* the son of thy handmaid: Thou hast loosed my bonds.
I will offer to thee the sacrifice of thanksgiving, And will call upon the name of the \sc Lord\sc*.
I will pay my vows unto the \sc Lord\sc* Now in the presence of all his people,
In the courts of the \sc Lordâ€™s\sc* house, In the midst of thee, O Jerusalem. Praise ye the \sc Lord\sc*.
